title.narrative: Yes I Do Pakistan

description.narrative: Millions of adolescent girls all over the world are facing a limited future because of early marriage (EM), teenage pregnancies and female genital mutilation/cutting (FGM/C). With this project, by changing the attitude of cummunity members and other key persons and informing adolescent girls and boys, adolescents will be empowered to stand up for their sexual reproductive health and rights (SRHR). Through education and economic empowerment, supported by the relevent legislation and policies, the project will give adolescents alternatives beyond EM, teenage pregnancies and FGM/C. The project will be implemented between 2016 and 2020 by Plan Nederland, together with partners AMREF, Rutgers, CHOICE, KIT and the Netherlands' Embassies in the relevant countries. It will be carried out in Ethiopia, Kenya, Zambia, Malawi, Indonesia and Pakistan

title.narrative: Adolescent girls and boys have increased access to ASRHR information and services and child protection services

description.narrative: No contributing partner

title.narrative: (qualitative) Changes observed relative to baseline in current access to SRHR information by girls and boys aged 15 to 24 years

description.narrative: Semi-structured in-depth interviews with girls aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years and boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years. And focus group discussions with groups of girls aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years and groups of boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years

comment.narrative: Scale: 0=no 1=few 2=some 3=most 4=all The qualitative data did not provide adequate data regarding the access to SRHR information by girls and boys aged 15 to 24 years.
Some young people have access to SRHR information

title.narrative: Adolescent girls and boys have increased access to ASRHR information and services- and child protection services

description.narrative: No contributing partners

title.narrative: % of young mothers aged 15-24 years indicating using MALEcondoms

description.narrative: A community-based cluster sample survey was administered at the household level among young girls and boys aged 15-24 in two intervention areas (Sanghar and Umerkot). The survey included question about child marriage. We obtained a sample size of 1600 using a standard formula- taking into account possible “design effects” because of the clustered sampling- we multiplied the required sample by 1.5 and had a ratio of 75% female respondents and 25% male respondents. A total of 1602 questionnaires were administered.

Adolescent girls can decide if when and whom to marry and if when and with whom to have children and are protected from female genital mutilation.

description.narrative: Plan contributed to the impact

title.narrative: % of girls below 18 years who left school due to marriage

description.narrative: A community-based cluster sample survey was administered at the household level among young girls and boys aged 15-24 in two intervention areas (Sanghar and Umerkot). The survey included question about child marriage. We obtained a sample size of 1600 using a standard formula- taking into account possible “design effects” because of the clustered sampling- we multiplied the required sample by 1.5 and had a ratio of 75% female respondents and 25% male respondents. A total of 1602 questionnaires were administered.

title.narrative: Adolescent girls can decide if when and whom to marry and if when and with whom to have children and are protected from female genital mutilation.

We obtained a sample size of 1600 using a standard formula- taking into account possible “design effects” because of the clustered sampling- we multiplied the required sample by 1.5 and had a ratio of 75% female respondents and 25% male respondents. A total of 1602 questionnaires were administered.

A total of 1602 questionnaires were administered.

title.narrative: Goal 5. Policy makers and duty bearers commit to implement laws and policies on CM and FGM and C

description.narrative: Plan contributed to the outcome

title.narrative: # of new or adjusted national and local law (incl. by-laws) and policies prohibiting CM and FGM and C (disaggregated by CM and FGM and C and by policies laws national level local level)

description.narrative: The data was collected through Key informant interviews with NGO staff and policy makers.

comment.narrative: In 2014, The Sindh Child Marriage Restraint Act 2013 was passed in the provincial assembly, declaring marriage below the age of 18 punishable by law in Sindh. In addition, the Sindh Hindu Marriage Act 2016 was also passed which enforces punishments for marriages below 18 years. According to the qualitative data, there is mixed awareness about these laws and the data indicated that these laws are not firmly implemented at all. Pakistani state courts and law enforcement officials have made efforts to arrest and prosecute perpetrators of forced child marriage and the exchange of young girls when complaints are received. However, such actions have been ad hoc rather than a result of a proactive pursuit of justice.

The Hindu Marriage bill was passed in 2017 in Pakistan to regulate marriages of Hindus who form a minority in the country. This came after the Sindh Hindu Marriages Act in 2016. Rules of business for the Sindh Child Marriage Restraint Act of 2013 were also specified. The Sindh Youth Policy was launched in 2018 to empower youth in the political, education and employment spheres.

title.narrative: Community and gate keepers understand benefits of changing norms and are aware of alternatives in relation to CM and TP and FGM

description.narrative: Plan contributed to the outcome

title.narrative: (qualitative) Changes observed relative to baseline in knowledge of gate keepers about harms of CM and TP

description.narrative: Semi-structured in-depth interviews gatekeepers (parents or caregivers grandmothers or elderly women and and or religious and traditional leaders and and or teachers and and or health and social workers and and or CBO and youth organization staff). In the interviews a question was included on the knowledge about harms of CM and TP

comment.narrative: Scale: 0=no 1=few 2=some 3=most 4=all Few gatekeepers have knowledge about the harms of child marriage and teenage pregnancies.
Several gatekeepers have knowledge about the harms of child marriage and teenage pregnancies.

title.narrative: Men and boys are successfully and actively engaged to reduce CM- TP and FGM and C

description.narrative: Plan contributed to the outcome

title.narrative: (qualitative) Changes observed relative to baseline in active engagement of men and boys in strategies reducing FGM and C and CM and TP (disaggregated by CM FGM and C and TP)

description.narrative: Semi-structured in-depth interviews with boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years and focus group discussions with groups of boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years.

comment.narrative: Scale: 0=no 1=few 2=some 3=most 4=all Meaningful engagement of both male and female in strategies reducing TP and CM is generally quite low.

Active engagement of men and boys in strategies to reduce CM and TP is present but needs to be improved. Although boys and young men are actively engaged to some extent, engagement of older men-particularly fathers is low. Boys and young men expressed they need to get trainings from LHWs as young women do, and to have more employment opportunities which for young women is improving. Young men and boys are largely aware of the harms of CM and TP, irrespective of education status and participation in the Yes I Do programme.

title.narrative: Men and boys are successfully and actively engaged to reduce CM- TP and FGM and C

description.narrative: Plan contributed to the outcome

title.narrative: (qualitative) Changes observed relative to baseline in active engagement of men and boys in strategies reducing FGM and C and CM and TP (disaggregated by CM FGM and C and TP)

description.narrative: Semi-structured in-depth interviews with boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years and focus group discussions with groups of boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years.

comment.narrative: Scale: 0=no 1=few 2=some 3=most 4=all Meaningful engagement of both male and female in strategies reducing TP and CM is generally quite low.

title.narrative: Political awareness increased and political will created

description.narrative: Plan contributed to the outcome

title.narrative: (qualitative) Changes observed relative to baseline in policy makers actively and openly supporting gender equality and girls rights

description.narrative: The data was collected through Key informant interviews with NGO staff and policy makers.

comment.narrative: Scale: 0=no 1=few 2=some 3=most 4=all Some policy-makers are aware of the laws related to CM however there is a lack of will within in the governement.

Policy makers are aware about the laws against child marriage and child protection as well as the discrimination faced by girls and young women on the basis of their gender, however it is unclear what exact actions they are have taken to support gender equality and girls' rights.

title.narrative: Goal 2. Adolescent girls and boys are meaningfully engaged to claim their SRH rights

description.narrative: Plan contributed to the outcome

title.narrative: (qualitative) Changes observed relative to baseline in girls and boys between 15 and 24 years old who feel they can advocate for themselves

description.narrative: Semi-structured in-depth interviews with girls aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years and boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years. And focus group discussions with groups of girls aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years and groups of boys aged between 15-19 and 20-24 years

comment.narrative: Scale: 0=no 1=few 2=some 3=most 4=all Very few girls and boys seem to have the ability to advocate for themselves.
Some girls and boys seem to have the ability to advocate for themselves especially if they are directly involved in Yes I Do activities.

title.narrative: Goal 1. Community members and gate-keepers have changed attitudes and take action to prevent CM FGM and C and TP.

description.narrative: Plan contributed to the outcome

title.narrative: (qualitative) Changes observed relative to baseline in attitudes and actions of gate keepers to prevent CM and TP (more or less supportive compared to baseline)

description.narrative: Semi-structured in-depth interviews gatekeepers (parents or caregivers grandmothers or elderly women and and or religious and traditional leaders and and or teachers and and or health and social workers and and or CBO and youth organization staff). In the interviews a question was included on the attitudes and actions re. CM and TP.

comment.narrative: Scale: 0=no 1=few 2=some 3=most 4=all Few gatekeepers have a positive attitude and are actively involved in preventing CM and TP.
Some gatekeepers have a positive attitude and are actively involved in preventing CM. TP is not a specific focus and is prevented by preventing child marriage as it usually occurs within marriage.

title.narrative: Adolescent girls and boys have increased access to ASRHR information and services- and child protection services

description.narrative: This indicator is based on the latest Demographic and Health Survey (DHS). No contributing partners

title.narrative: % ofcurrent use of contraceptive among all women 20-24 years - any modern method

description.narrative: Data from DHS 2012
